title.narrative: Strengthening Intellectual Property Rights in Pakistan

description.narrative: Intellectual Property Rights (IPR) enforced through patents, trademarks and industrial designs enhance investment and stimulate growth, creativity and innovation. Therefore, the protection of intellectual property is critical to developing a competitive national economy that is able to compete on globalised markets. This project will facilitate the provision of technical training, capacity building and general cooperation between the Danish Patent and Trademark Office (DKPTO) and the Intellectual Property Organization of Pakistan (IPO). Through a series of webinars, a study tour, a technical mission and targeted workshops, the project will build capacity within IPO and strengthen procedures for examination and evaluation of patents and trademarks.

mailing-address.narrative: Embassy of Denmark, House #16, Street #21, F- 6/2, P.O.Box 1118

sector.narrative: Public sector policy and administrative management

description.narrative: FL §06.38.02.18 Strategic activities in growth economies

title.narrative: Introduction to quality assurance measures, examination practices and applicant services for patents, trademarks and industrial designs in DKPTO

# of webinars completed prior to the study tour to Denmark (including broad participation and relevant content as defined in the activity agreement)
# of study tours by IPO to Denmark completed (with broad participation and relevant content as defined in the activity agreement)
Feedback gathered from IPO participants in a survey by DKPTO about insights acquired on Danish IPR management and the relevance of these insights towards strengthening management capacity within IPO

target.value:
1 webinar completed
1 study tour by IPO to Denmark completed
Improved insight into Danish examination procedures (patents/trademarks/industrial designs) among IPO staff. All IPO participants view the study tour as having been useful towards strengthening management capacity on IPR within IPO

title.narrative: Technical training on quality assurance measures, examination practices and applicant services for patents, trademarks and industrial designs

Feedback gathered from IPO participants in a survey by DKPTO about knowledge acquired on DKPTO best practices and the relevance of the trainings supplied towards strengthening management capacity within IPO

target.value:
1 webinar completed
1 technical mission by DKPTO to Pakistan completed
1 workshop on IPR specifically in relation to the health sector and pharmaceutical products completed
3 relevant stakeholders from the private sector represented at workshop
1 relevant Pakistani authority represented at workshop in addition to IPO
Better understanding among all participants about Danish best practices on quality management measures, search and examination procedures and applicant services / customer relations. All IPO participants view the trainings as having been useful towards strengthening management capacity on IPR within IPO
